name: ball
content:
ball noun
(ROUND OBJECT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 [ C ] any object in the shape of a sphere, especially one used as a toy by children or in various sports such as tennis and football: a beach/golf/tennis ball Just try to concentrate on hitting the ball. The kitten curled itself into a ball (= the shape of a ball).
Steve Wisbauer/Stockbyte/GettyImages
A1 [ C ] a long piece of thread that has been rolled into a ball: a ball of string/wool
Michael Burrell/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
[ C ] the rounded part of your foot or thumb where the toes join the foot and the thumb joins the hand
JoKMedia/E+/GettyImages
[ C ] US (also Christmas ball); (UK bauble) a ball-shaped Christmas decoration for hanging on a tree
sergeyryzhov/iStock / Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesShe kicked the ball so powerfully that it flew over the hedge.He rolled the clay into a ball in his hands.My golf was terrible today - I just didn't strike the ball well.The ball bounced off the post and into the net.He wound the string into a ball.

ball noun
(KICK/THROW OF BALL)
in football, a pass from one player to another: Long picked up a great ball from Campbell and rounded the keeper to score.
in baseball, a ball that is thrown to the batter but that the batter does not try to hit because it is outside the hitting area
